faded away.

An oval shaped glowing red object, in two dimensions. It spun in one
direction then reversed and swung in the other.
A UFO Southwest of Liverpool.
Lights rising from the ground into the sky, much like debris from a fire. However lights were too intense to be a fire. Seen in the direction of the North Downs from Maidstone.
A bright orange object moving at a steady pace.

A bright flaming object, about a quarter of the size of the moon. It
was like a special effect. It was silent and went from horizon to horizon, starting in the North.

Like a large black parachute with nothing suspended from it. It
changed shape and gradually got smaller as it went into the distance. Observed for 10-20 minutes.

A long shaped vehicle with a red light at the front and two gold lights either side. Hovered above the house and then moved off to the right at tremendous speed before returning. It then drifted slowly
away. It was louder than a plane or helicopter.
A bright red light over the house.

A large black ball with a light underneath. Travelling South over
western Bury St Edmunds at 3000ft at 200 miles an hour.

A black spherical object 12m in diameter. It was 500ft up and travelling at 500 mph. It made no sound. It had a light on but
switched it off when the witness shone a torch at it.

Two bright lights heading towards the city. Like a white octopus
shaped kite. It was like they were propelled but travelling on their own.

A spherical object with a red flashing light underneath. It was stationary in the sky for 10 minutes and then just faded away. It had
made no movement at all.

Single small white orb shortly joined by two others. Changed into a dull flat circular shape. They were hovering over Central London at 15-20,000 ft but not blown by the wind. Objects disappeared but one
reappeared for five minutes.

Looked like a star or satellite. Saw three within 20 minutes. Came from the south. Its speed increased and then slowed down. Finally
headed east over the North Sea.

A big bright orange light. It turned white and then disappeared very
quickly. It made no noise.
A sighting.

Two orange lights flying in a parallel formation in an arc. One slowed and went behind the other then they both gradually faded away. Far too fast to be aircraft. They had no flashing lights and made no
sound.

A very small white light with no flashing lights or smoke trail.
Headed north then did a sharp turn to the east and then was just gone.
A bright green light that whizzed about the sky for an hour. It was very fast and a few planes got in its way.

Saw orange lights that looked like flames. They were heading South to North towards Preston. Police said it was the open rear of an
aircraft undertaking parachute training.

Six very bright orange lights flying in formation passed by in 15
minutes. Heading from Upper Norwood towards Crystal Palace.

Initially one then five pitch black hot air balloon shaped objects with
continual flames underneath.

A large bright yellow object hovering in the sky. Too bright to be an aircraft and the wrong colour. It didn't move for ages and then
disappeared in the blink of an eye.

A slow moving, silent, orangey/red light. Does not think it was a
helicopter or aircraft. Flew at same height as a helicopter.

Six bright white & orange lights, two single and two in two object formation. Lower and faster than a satellite. Witness contacted local
police who had no other reports.

Two bright orangey/red lights  moving towards Durham/Tees Valley
Airport. The objects flew steady, level and straight.

A shiny black flying cylinder, 20-30ft long at about 4700ft which was 200ft above the pilots aircraft. Although the pilot sighted the object.
Air Traffic Control forwarded details to the UFO Desk.

Seven orange orbs that suddenly disappeared. They were on a North-South trajectory. Witness contacted Cardiff Air Traffic Control
who had nothing on radar.

Nine bright orange lights moving at slow speed and at 2000ft. They
made no sound.
An orange flash and a loud bang.

Three bright small lights very close together travelling in a straight line. They were flashing rapidly but made no noise and looked like they were on fire but clearly were not. Speed of 100-150mph at
1000ft. Came back eight minutes later.

A UFO over the witnesses house. It was at 30,000ft and he has seen
it before.

A diamond shaped orange light. If you held out your hand it would have been the size of a 20p coin. It was totally silent. The object carried on in the distance and then another one appeared and
followed the same path.

Four big lights in a line formation. Two dropped down and the other
two moved off quickly into the distance.
Twenty orange balls heading north.

Like a star, but jumping all over the sky. It was 70 degrees above the horizon. It was a blue/white colour and occasionally red and left
a light trail.
A very bright light. It made no sound but was very low.

A bright orange light. Too bright for a Chinese lantern. The light looked electrical not a flame. Travelled in a straight line at a steady speed. Travelled East to West with the wind. Made no noise. It was
about the size of a quarter moon.

Four flaming balloons that disappeared over the horizon fairly
quickly. Was not very high.

A strange blue light near the Cardington Hangers. Flew straight past
the witness.

8-10 bright red lights. They were hovering. They moved independently into the distance and disappeared when a light aircraft
appeared.

Seven bright orange lights in the sky. Silent. Travelling towards the
Wirral.
A big bright light. Came from west Cornwall towards Plymouth.
A series of orange balls of fire.

An ellipse shaped object the size of a commercial plane. It was on fire. It glowed bright orange. It moved South East to North and then returned and hovered for at least a minute. Moved further away at
supersonic speed.
A very bright blue light flew behind the house.

Very strange circular objects without definite shape. They stayed
around for about five minutes. They were 8-9 of them.

Ten orange lights in a line with intermittent gaps. They made no
sound and flew at helicopter height.

A big bright light. Thought it was a helicopter at first. Within seconds followed by three others and then a further three. Flew low but made
no sound.
A strange sighting.
A very big red light moving slowly. It then faded away.

An orange light travelling from the south. It was followed by two
more orange lights on the same path, then five more and then two more. They made no noise but were at the height of a helicopter.
Seven bright red lights.

A white object with a silver beam coming from it, over Pugneys Country Park. It looked square but changed shape as it moved about. Witness saw it through binoculars. An aircraft flew very close
to it.

Three objects like fireballs falling to earth. They were glowing and orange. There was one large object and two smaller ones which converged together and rose into the atmosphere until they faded
away.
Three small yellow orbs travelling quite slow.

A UFO. It was a "glowing ball of something or other". Definitely not a
plane.
A sighting.

A bright circular amber light, the size of a 2p coin. It was moving very slowly in a straight line but once it flew over the witnesses house it accelerated away very very quickly into the distance. It
made no noise and left no vapour trail.

Two clusters of bright lights. They were stationary for a while then the first group of 15 headed towards Woodbridge followed by the second cluster of 6-7 lights. They were very high up. They made no
sound.

Three distinct sets of green, orange and white lights. Don't match any constellation and are in the wrong place. Static to the eye but
with binoculars are moving at speed and at random.

Was watching shooting stars when the witness saw two bright
luminous orange objects like birds or swans. Does not think they were birds as they moved too fast.
Black shaped square object.

Two objects seen.  Photograph taken in June a week after the
mystery hot air balloon search.

Saw a long greyish tube in the sky, when driving home along the
A4031.
A sighting.
Eleven bright star like objects heading North East.
Bright orange lights. A single light followed by a group of three and then another single light. On a North East to South West track.
Different coloured pulsating lights. Police checked with Air Traffic Control who said they had nothing. Police suspect Chinese lanterns.

Initially two UFOs increasing to six. Bright orange. Last four were
bigger and brighter than the first two.

A very bright orange circular shape. Got smaller as it moved away.
Moving South West to South.
A UFO.

Black disc shaped objects hovering over crop circles near Barbury
Castle. They cast shadows on the ground.

Two huge lights chasing each other like cat and mouse. It was broken cloud and the lights would never leave the clouds, just go to the edge. It looked like a strong light was coming from above the
clouds. They both shot off to the North.

A large orange glowing ball in the sky. It was stationary and not very
high up.
A UFO.

Two objects the size of light aircraft but perfectly spherical and
glowing bright orange. They were solid and made no sound. They headed NW to SE.

11-12 objects in the sky. Witness thinks they may be Chinese
lanterns.

Ten orange lights moving at a sedate pace West to East. Went from
horizon to horizon in two minutes.

50-100 objects moving together in the same direction. They were
helicopter sized but made no noise.
A light at about 1000ft. It split in two and flew away.

A circular object, metallic in colour. It was following a plane. It shot downwards several times and then back up again to the same level
as the plane.

A bright circle of fire travelling South Westerly. It was only a few
hundred feet up moving silently across the sky at 30mph and then after four minutes, vanished.

Looked like a highly lit aeroplane with wings. It was heading NNW to
SSE. It was visible for 20 seconds then changed direction quickly and dropped out of the sky or disappeared.

Witness was watching two helicopters (one a Chinook) coming from the Edinburgh area when she saw an orb shaped object through her binoculars glistening in the sun. The orb was quite high above the
helicopters.

Three orange lights south of Bridport coming from the east. They were the size of a two thirds moon. Moved away to the West rapidly
diminishing.
Twelve bright lights in the sky. Moving slowly.

Object approached from the direction of Doncaster. It was a bright orange ball in the sky. It kept a level flight path then stopped. It then zigzagged a few times before shooting off  at tremendous speed,
vanishing in a few seconds.

Six round brilliant objects in pairs, apart from the last two which were
in line. Travelling South to East.
A UFO.

An orange light. Light(s) travelled in formation like a mis-shaped
diamond. There were 12-13 of them. They travelled left to right.

Red objects moving slowly. They were not high and were silent.
Might have been going over Bakewell.

Nine objects like golden globes. They hovered for a bit and were
joined by three others before shooting off.

Two orange balls of light travelling North in parallel to each other.
Then a further ball of light was seen, heading North. The lights made no noise. They faded and then disappeared.

Two brown objects like balls of fire. Appeared to be in convoy
heading towards Portreath.

Four UFOs flying North. They were silent. A plane was flying in the
opposite direction.

Up to 20 orange and red glowing lights. They appeared to be in formation and under some form of control. They came from the Eastern horizon. They moved upwards, were then stationary, moved side to side and then disappeared upwards. Seen for 20 minutes.

A roundish glowing shape. Flying at a steady speed with no noise. It
was a clear night. Filmed it but the camera died.
Something strange.

Seemed like a rather large disc or round in appearance. It was dark in colour but bounced sunlight off its surface. It was floating or bobbing up and down. Other aircraft were at the same altitude and
could be heard, the object made no noise.
Two UFOs.

Several sightings over the period. A bright orb that travelled in a straight line. As a helicopter approached it the orb slowed down and vanished. Helicopter reacted as if pilot was startled. Saw several
other orbs, but the main one was half the size.

A bright orange light seen through the tree line. It turned and cleared the tree line. The other side of the object appeared to be a large rectangle shape of fire red/orange. It was silent. The object slowly
climbed in the direction of Gloucester.

Two very bright orange lights that appeared to get closer to the car then just hung in the sky. Five minutes later a second bright orange light with red glow seen then disappeared. A third light then hung in
the sky and disappeared after five minutes.

Six bright orange/red lights in formation. They climbed like balloons
and made no sound. A sphere like a balloon appeared at the side and then another.
A round orange light.

A bright yellowy orange object, travelling SE to NW in a straight line.
It made no noise. At a 50 degree angle of elevation.

Eight alien aircraft seen just above helicopter height travelling SW to NE. There was a humming sound. They looked like they were
"eyeing the place up".

12-15 objects. Not like normal fixed wing aircraft, more like bright orange lights. Moving West at indeterminate height. Objects entered
cloud then turned around.

A red light followed by 7 others. They came from the West, flew
overhead and disappeared. Definitely not aircraft.

Some 30 orange lights heading from Birmingham Airport towards
Coleshill.

Three very bright orange lights. Fairly large and moving much faster than an aircrfat. They disappeared. Then two lights appeared from the South. The lights appeared co-ordinated. They were not aircraft.

A dormant blue light which changed colour many times over the hour it was witnessed. At first it was moving steadily and then it stopped in  mid air. Then started moving from left to right. A white
beam could be seen shining down from it. It had red lights.

Two objects, one with a brighter light. The second one was behind it and had a dimmer light. No navigation lights. Not normal. Reluctant
to say it was a UFO - perhaps it is a plane.
A UFO. Witness photographed it.

Five orange bright lights. Half a mile distance between each one.
Took photos.

Fast, shiny discs. Lower and faster than a plane, not a plane or
helicopter. Sphere, brilliant light.

Two sightings. First at 12:30 (bright light), second at 01:30 (flashing
green).
Observed fifty golden balls moving slowly SSE.

Having a BBQ with some friends when saw an orange fireball about to crash two gardens away, but on checking it was now high in the sky about half mile away. 3-5 minutes later another object appeared then a third spherical object with a leg protruding.
A UFO.

Ball of light. No noise. Bright light, rising behind a fence, went up
into the sky.
Huge red light, moving through sky.
A UFO.
No description provided.

A large bright silver/white ball/sphere. Moving slowly W to E. the object was much bigger and brighter than an aircraft. It appeared to stop still several times as it went into the distance. The light did not
dim as it moved further away.

Very bright, very big, not a satellite, not a plane, stationary. Light
disappeared.

Bright star, went from bright yellow to bright red. Did not look like a
shooting star or plane. Moved no more than 2-3 feet.
A UFO.

A round white object. Not like a ball. Very bright but not casting a beam of light. It was rising vertically. The higher it went the smaller it became. It started the size of a pound coin and ended as a pin head.
Witness observed the object for two minutes.

A very bright white light like a star. It moved south then double backed on itself and was joined by another light. The lights danced round each other then split and moved off in different directions. The
light suddenly disappeared.
A UFO.

A ball of light the size of a small car, 26 metres above the ground. It pulsated every 5-8 seconds but then shot off. Definitely not an
aircraft or a Chinese Lantern.

A bright orange light, which hovered in one place. It became more
pink, than red and then it disappeared.

A metallic aircraft shaped like a missile. One quarter was white, another green/blue and another red. Was circling. It had no wings
and was moving diagonally. It made a sound like a motorbike.
Saw an object like a ball of fire.
Has a video of UFO on his mobile phone.

An orb like object at 120 degrees from North. Orange in colour moving in a NE direction. Visible for 10 minutes. It had no aircraft
type navigation lights.

Three bright orange lights, not flashing. Very big, high up, set
equally apart. Reported it to RAF Northolt. Never saw anything like this before.

A UFO of orangey/red colour. It hovered and moved slightly in the
direction of Stroud, then suddenly dropped downwards.
10-15 circular objects.
A bright, reddish light travelling W to E, below cloud level. It made no sound. It was moving in a straight line but too slow to be a meteorite. It had no navigation type lights.

10-12 bright orange objects, silent. Has a photo of them saved on
his mobile.
A UFO.
Six yellow lights, stationary at first then moved off.

Four-five orange lights, fluctuating lights. Lives under flight path of Donnington airfield. Objects moved in a line. Lights faded. Returned
10 minutes later.
Video footage in Cornwall near an Air Station (possibly Culdrose). Five minute sighting.

Large round object. Two planes flew round it. Could be something
natural, such as an eclipse.

Light seen in sky also above this was a large round shape which
looked rocky and was blue and pink in colour.

15 to 20 orange and red lights looked as though they were coming
down to land but then went over head and 'went out'.

Saw through the clouds flashing pale blue lights odd shapes but mostly circles. Movement continued for 25 minutes. A small red light was on outside parameter of blue lights which disappeared/amalgamated into one large blue light which speedily
disappeared.
Bright, oval shaped object with red and green lights. No noise.
Large balloon shape, with 'shimmer fire' effect underneath it.

UFO seen with another one circling it.  There was one main light and
no sound.

Big and very bright red/yellow/orange ball seen flying past backend of garden, just under cloud cover. Then went through cloud cover
and lit cloud cover up.

Orange light, with 'some sort of flame' in the sky.  Moved from driveway to over the front of the house.  Then changed direction towards Wallgrave, direction changed again towards Reading then
back in the direction of Wallgrave.
Fifteen red/orangey lights in sky, which gradually started fading out and then disappearing.

Six orange, with fire around, UFOs in formation (One behind the
other across horizon to horizon).

Six orange/white lights, lying astern.  Thought they were aircraft navigation lights but were evenly spaced out.  No noise but moved with speed of a passing helicopter. Changed into a 'hammer head'
shape.

Six or seven bright lights which were in the sky for approximately 10 minutes. They were spaced out and one by flew away and
disappeared very quickly.

Three orange lights high in the sky over the sea.  There was an explosion and the centre light then dropped into the sea.  No sound
heard from the lights.

Seven bright orange lights in a straight line. Only two lights were in view at any time. As the last two came a white moon ball flew over at double the speed of the orange lights. Thirty minutes later six
white balls in a triangle formation were seen.
Triangular shaped object.

Three huge orange lights. First and second objects moving at speed of an aircraft. Third object moving much faster as if trying to catch
up.

Two bright orange lights, three to four minutes a part and no sound
heard.  Lights then went into clouds.

Five, really bright orange flame ball type objects seen flying across the sky, moving irregularly. One moving faster than a plane and one zig-zagged down towards the ground then reappeared after the other four had moved across the sky and had gone.

First saw three orange objects. Forty minutes later, looking North saw an orange glowing object travelling slowly from SW to NE. It
was at an angle to the ground of about 30-40 deg.

A bright orange light travelling in a straight line from Brighton
Centre. Which then passed over the house.

Saw an orange, yellow object in the sky, with the shape similar to a
hot air balloon.
Has a UFO report in their office.

Three bright orange lights and one dimmer one. Faded after being
static.
Saw a UFO.

Went to get cat off wall, saw UFO higher than eye level, bright
orange object, not plane shaped, no engine noise.
Just reported a sighting.  No other details.
Bright object in sky, very large.
60-70 lights, suddenly disappearing.

Nine bright orange circular shapes glide across sky. Sighting lasted
a couple of minutes.

Clusters of UFOs, orange lights in distance. Zoomed off when they
got closer, big and round.
Large orange ball of flame.  Lasted 20 seconds.

Lights moving slowly. One light lead a group of five, with one light
acting as tail ender.
17 UFO's above village. Red and green lights, no sound.
Orange lights in sky.
Looked like aeroplane on fire.
Scary sighting.
Orange point of light in the sky.  No haze or smoke visible around the object. Object was flickering slightly. Lasted about 60 secs.
Bright light.

Saw glider like objects in the sky. Flying around in an anti-clockwise
direction.
Red object, looked like a clod, went over the roof and vanished. No noise/engine. Big orange colour lower than a plane. Gliding straight.

Large orange glow in sky, moving slowly than disappeared.
Reappeared after five minutes. Knows a bit about astronomy.
Low bright light.

Saw orange ball in distance, no flashing lights, no engine noise. Left
suddenly.
Large oval craft seen, very low and could not make out any distinguishing features. It had on it a number of red, orange and green lights.  Sighting lasted only 5-10 seconds.

A bright white fire ball, size of a football flew into the kitchen and landed in a plastic carrier bag on the table, immediately disappeared but seemed to cause almost blinding white, sheet lightening.

Saw an orange light rising from the SE - looked like the tail from a rocket launch like when the shuttle goes up. Object then moved north before disappearing behind clouds. Happened three times over
a period of 30 minutes. Third time bright flash.
Large bright light. Looked like a ball of fire or a hot air balloon.

Saw four strange orange lights in the sky following each other. Lights then just disappeared. Lights then seen again moving across the night sky.  Went inside and saw the same lights in a three prong
triangle.

Saw six moving orange balls, glowing. They were following each
other.  One minute between them.  There was no noise.

Orb shape, glowing on underside only. Orange colour. Orange faded
and object looked like a black shadow.
Big circular orange lights.
Unusual lights above Cardiff travelling silently.
Six balloons of fire over Ullswater.  These UFOs moved at different speeds to each other and in different directions before burning out.
Unusual lights travelling silently from West to East.

Six to seven bright orange lights, moving down Wirral peninsula
from Birkenhead to Ellesmere Port. No noise. Saw a second UFO five minutes later.
Eight orange, non-flashing lights, made no sound. Round shapes.

Four wavering lights, hovering, taken on a video camera and
photographed.
Five to six objects.

Two yellow lights one above the other in the sky.  On arriving home five minutes later watched the lights disappear behind a narrow
cloud bank.

Two sightings observed. One in summer 2008 single bright yellow/white light moving fast. Second sighting in daylight single
bright yellow/white 2009 moving fast.

Bright orange bulb. Stayed for 10 minutes, came towards him like a
tornado then disappeared.
Very large bright light, no sound.

Bright orange object which looked as though it was on fire. Moving at a steady pace, slowed then gained altitude slowly and disappeared into the clouds.  Sighting lasted 2-3 minutes.  Object
was similar to a hot air balloon but had no outline or shape.

Bright light form the northwest - lights went out, turned towards the
south.

Saw a very bright orange ball shaped object in the sky. No noise
from object. Went to get mobiles to take pictures and videos but object had just vanished.
Lights coming towards me. 40-50 lights.
One object seen in the sky in the day time.
Report received from "Psychic Control Centre", ref: PO255401.

Report on behalf of her sister, who said she saw a UFO at Holborn
Station.

Bright red orange ball, no sound, moved faster than an aircraft.
Could not find a camera in time to take photos.

UFO visible for 6 -7 second. Changed direction by approx 60 degs downward towards the horizon before disappearing. Object was a dull brown colour, with a magnitude of 3.5 to 5 and resembled a
slightly luminous brown paper bag. No sound was heard.

Saw a meteor shower which contained something he could not
explain.

Bright light shone through the window. Saw three lights size of a
basket ball moving up/down and rotating on own axis. Seemed to loose power after 30 seconds and vanished.
Dog wanted to go out, went out and I saw a UFO.

No flashing lights, orange looking object. Looked like it was hovering, flew towards observer's car and faded slowly into the
distance.

Pair of "lanterns" directly overhead, slightly faster than a plane,
faster than a satellite, slower than a meteor.

One light, joined by another, hovering over the village. No noise. One light no longer there, the other disappeared. Like a lightbulb
with an orange top

Very bright light, stops and spins slowly, moves right and left, as if
looking for something or taking photos, long beams of light. No sound.
Bright orange light, definitely not a plane.
Two bright orange lights. Witnessed for about five minutes.

Emitting a large bright orange light much larger than normal lights on a plane/helicopter, travelling in an arc with no sound. After 10 mins light became dimmer and appeared to gain height, light now size as normal aircraft light and disappeared.

A bright orange object. Above cloud level. Travelling at a high rate of knots. Came inland from the coast over Exmouth and headed off
towards Woodbury and Taunton.

Was carrying a camera, as is her usual practice, saw a pinpoint, a
silver dot that was clearly a UFO.

Three red lights in the shape of a triangle with the nose moving
forward, not a usual aircraft, suspect it was a UFO.
Three orange orbs and two red orbs.
Wish to report a UFO.

Circular shape in with a mixture of stars, one was getting brighter and then dimmer and disappearing for a short number of minutes. Another red light hovered around the object. Camera on phone
would not pick anything up.
Lights in sky.
Saw a UFO - can you call me back.
Saw something strange. Can you phone me back.
Five orange globe balls.
UFO at the back of the sky
Tall and thin, like a pencil, square, blue black.

Saw 40 flickering orange lights from kitchen window. They made no noise and moved round to the side window of the house and
disappeared behind a cloud.  Watched them for 5-10 minutes.
Two orbs, flickering lights, sliding across the sky.

Around eight yellow balls of light floating slowly in the night sky, slowly disappearing. Then one or two more would appear 500 to 800 ft and follow same line of flight.  This happened for around two
minutes.
Large orange light with no noise.
Saw a UFO.
Bright orange lights, lasted for two minutes, went out, than four more. Could have been a meteorological balloon. A very bright light.

Three lights in formation, forming an isosceles triangle. Two lights
visible at first, then joined by a third. Light lasted for 2-3 minutes. No sound.
Report of a UFO.
A large orange fireball burning for 35 seconds. No noise from object which reduced in size until nothing over the duration of its flight.
Strange lights over G62 0TD. Two big white lights.
Seven aircraft over Derby.
It got brighter and dimmer
Came over top of field - red- flew very quickly like a shooting star.

Round shape - lightening then darkening with a dark shape behind it.
No engine noise.
Saw a bright light heading towards Essex - bright light standing still.

Orange ball going in a straight line.  No visible trail.  No smoke or
noise. Appeared to be getting smaller burning itself up.
Saw what looked like a flying log, blue with a white edge.

Terrestrials seen coming from King's Lynn towards Swaffham,
Norfolk.
Saw a sighting in Gloucester.
Two UFOs flying overhead.
Has video of UFO with no sound.

Two glowing sphere/domed -shaped objects followed each in South
East direction.  Completely silent and not flashing at all, as you would expect from aircraft.

One object rising in the sky. Semi circle outline. Flames glowing orange/red.  Flickering round the edge. At first thought it was a
firework, then it disappeared.
Seven lights over Yeovil.  No noise.

Orange lights following each other in same direction. No noise, no flashing lights, same trajectory. In vicinity of Lyneham radar.  Some
lights disappeared.

Saw lights, moved into view from right to left, then stop and form a
pattern before pulsing and fading out their bright orange lights.
Twenty-two lights.  No noise, same speed.

Saw strange lights in the sky, in three's then one, then two's, then
three's - Fifteen in all.

Red fire like ball . Glow was constant.  It was travelling at a constant speed West to East. Also watched it through binoculars and it appeared as a red circle with dots around the circle. In 10 o'clock
position and watched it for 4-5 mins.

Saw eight orange single lights in the sky. Lights were very clear, single bright orange spot, which travelled at constant speed slowly higher into the eastern atmosphere. At first four lights in close
proximity followed by four more with approx one minute.

Approx 10 orange lights flying over. First eight were going at a
steady, slow rate, three of which merged into a triangle formation, separated then disappeared. Two others appeared about a minute or so travelling faster and disappeared at same area of sky.
Saw a vertical cylinder, silvery colour and underneath was a great bright yellow, fiery glow.  Watched the object for about 20 minutes.
Ball of fire in the sky.
Very bright object above the sun.

Six bright orange lights - not flashing - silent. After a few minutes
there was another one.

Saw a very bright light - looking south to right of the moon.  It was
very large.  There were four or five bright lights.

Moving very fast SE to North and watched object for about 10
seconds. Thought at first it was a star or a plane.

Brilliant and dazzling pure white horizontal ring of light.  It appeared to be perfectly still in the sky above the houses and was totally silent.  Object was hovering over the Belle Vue Crescent area.
Low flying object.  Nine orange lights, no sound.

Eight, orange UFOs, shone brightly, travelling at speed, low in the sky. Objects came across one by one with approx 20 seconds between them. They stopped over the reservoir changed direction at
approx 90 deg angle towards Holmfirth.  No noise.

Semi-circle of light, golden orange, moved off towards the east.  No
noise heard.

Saw 25 to 30 bright orange lights in the sky - Flying in a triangular
shape.
Fifteen to twenty bright vertical line going slowly - no noise.

Saw three UFOs which appeared to be composed of fiery orange
light and a symmetrical vertical diamond shape.  No sound.

Pink and red dome with a bright yellow light underneath. For about
30 seconds.
Two round balls were in the sky chasing each other.

Thirty orange globes, in four waves, travelling at a constant speed. May have been lanterns of some kind but they would have been 1-2
Metres in diameter.

Saw Orange flamed lights, in formation slowly and silently across
the night sky.

Black sphere. Bobbing about half a mile away . Covered with a phospherous chemical cloud.  It goes light grey. Flash of lightening then re-appears. Some of the clouds light up.  Various sightings
20:30 and 12:15.
Saw a UFO it was not a plane it disappeared very quickly.

An intense, bright white light seen between the flight path of Gatwick
and Heathrow.
Just a sighting.
